title: Nakamura, Kōchi
text:
was a <a href="Cities%20of%20Japan">city</a> located in <a href="K%C5%8Dchi%20Prefecture">Kōchi Prefecture</a>, <a href="Japan">Japan</a>. The city was in the southwestern part of Kōchi and known for its shrine. The city was founded on March 31, 1954 on the banks of the <a href="Shimanto%20River">Shimanto-gawa</a>, the last free flowing river in Japan.
As of 2003, the city had an estimated <a href="population">population</a> of 34,366 and the <a href="population%20density">density</a> of 89.38 persons per km². The total area was 384.50 km².
On April 10, 2005, Nakamura, along with the village of <a href="Nishitosa%2C%20K%C5%8Dchi">Nishitosa</a> (from <a href="Hata%20District%2C%20K%C5%8Dchi">Hata District</a>), was merged to create the city of <a href="Shimanto%2C%20K%C5%8Dchi%20%28city%29">Shimanto</a>.
